books.description: A list of books useful for people first learning how to build web XML web applications.

book.title: XQuery
book.author: Priscilla Walmsley
book.description: This book is a detailed, through and complete tour of the W3C Query language. It covers all the key aspects of the language as well as a chapter for people familiar with SQL.

book.title: XQuery Wikibook
book.author: Chris Wallace
Dan McCreary
Joe Wicentowski
Jens Ã˜stergaard Petersen
book.description: This book provides a variety of XQuery example programs and is designed to work with the eXist open-source native XML application server.

book.title: XForms Tutorial and Cookbook
book.author: Dan McCreary
book.description: This book is an excellent guide for anyone that is just beginning to learn the XForms standard. The book is focused on providing the reader with simple, but complete examples of how to create XForms web applications.

book.title: XRX: XForms, Rest and XQuery
book.author: Dan McCreary
book.description: This book is an overview of the key architectural and design patters.

book.title: RESTful Web Services
book.author: Leonard Richardson
Sam Ruby
book.description: An excellent to RESTful web services

book.title: Enterprise Integration Patterns
book.author: Gregor Hohpe
Bobby Woolf
book.description: This book contains a collection of named integration patters.

book.title: XPath
book.author: User:Psweatte
Dan McCreary
book.description: A collection of samples of how to use XPath expressions.

book.title: Making Sense of NoSQL
book.author: Ann Kelly
Dan McCreary
book.description: Overview of NoSQL for managers and architects.

book.title: eXist
book.author: Adam Retter
Erik Siegel
book.description: Overview of the eXist native XML database.
